words.def: (of words) formed in imitation of a natural sound
the person or thing chosen or selected
elegance by virtue of being fashionable
the repetition of a sound resulting from reflection of the sound waves
the circulating life energy that in Chinese philosophy is thought to be inherent in all things
a tool with a flat blade attached at right angles to a long handle
water frozen in the solid state
a very light colorless element that is one of the six inert gasses
a midwestern state in north central United States in the Great Lakes region
a trivalent metallic element of the rare earth group
A working-class punk rock  subgenre of the 1970s, sometimes associated with racism.
